description: St John the Evangelist, Palmers Green, is a prominent landmark on Green Lanes, the church was designed by John Oldrid Scott and was built 1903-1909. There is a wealth of post first world war Morris & Co glass, the east window by J.H. Dearle being particularly striking. There are more recent windows by Godard & Gibbs and a notable one of 1918 by Frank Salisbury.

events.name: Façades a new piece by Brigitte Beraha

factsheet.heading: ‘Façades’ - a new piece by Brigitte Beraha
paragraphs: Brigitte Beraha is a composer, vocalist and lyricist who has written a piece of music for 4 a cappella female voices. They will specifically make use of the acoustics of this church through this new body of work as a direct response to the occasion and also to the building itself, its natural acoustics and surrounding reverb. Through the music the musicians will express the dichotomy between the exterior façade of the Church - which sits quietly amongst the outside noise of the streets -  and the inside of the building, where one might find beauty in the moment, and a moment of calm and solace within the acoustic space that they are in.
This event is part of Enfield Creatives’ Collection.
This co curated Collection has been made possible with support from the Enfield Society and UKSP funding.
